content: beacon hill beanie juls wools @juls_wools introduction the beacon hill beanie is a knitted skull style cap inspired by 90s skater fashion but with a feminine twist this beanie is knitted with alternating colors but can be adjusted to use more or less colors the pattern can also be modified to accommodate different head sizes i recommend knitting with a strand of brushed alpaca or mohair to display a more fluffy fuzzy look this will be my first pattern release & i would love to see your creations by using #beaconhillbeanie and tagging @juls_wools on instagram or tiktok materials drops lima held by 1 strand of drops melody 1 skein each 6 5mm circular needles with 24cm cord if using magic loop method or 6 5mm double-pointed needles sizing & customization this pattern was created based on a head circumference of 21 5in 54 5cm the number of casted on stitches can be modified to the creator s head circumference if modifying please ensure the number of casted on stitches are divisible by 4 also the number of row knitted for the base of the beanie can be adjusted based on head size gauge 13 stitches x 21 row knitted in stockinette on 6 5mm needles = 4 x 4 in 10 x 10 cm abbreviations k knit st stitch k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip 2 stitches knit-wise place back on left needle knit those stitches together through back loop techniques follow the instructions below to create a seamless look when switching between colors 1 switch color k all st in round & slip_stitch marker 2 at start of next round slip color a stitch knit-wise from row below & place on left needle 3 knit 2 colors together for first st 4 finish by knitting all remaining stitches in round instructions 1 long-tail cast on 68 sts of color a join in the round & place a stitch marker to begin the round 2 base of beanie row 1 k all sts row 2 k all sts row 3 switch to color b k all sts row 4 use technique described above k all sts row 5 k all sts repeat row 3-5 in color a & color b 2 times each* 3 color a stripes in total 3 color b stripes in total on the last row place stitch markers as follows last row *k1 place stitch marker k16 place stitch marker* repeat til end of row instructions cont 3 decreases row 1 *k1 slip_stitch marker ssk k to 2 sts before stitch marker k2tog slip_stitch marker* repeat til end of row 60 sts row 2 k all sts row 3 k all sts repeat row 1-3 in color a & color b 3 times each 7 color a row in total from base 6 color b row in total from base there are now 12 sts remaining on needles 4 top of hat *slip 1 st knit-wise k1 pass slipped st over knitted st* repeat
